{{EngvarB|date=June 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2014}} {|{{Infobox ship begin |infobox caption=}} <!-- warship classes --><!----> {{Infobox ship image |Ship image=[[File:Immediate Support Vessels T-38, T-39 & T-40 ready for commissioning.jpg|350px]] |Ship caption= Immediate Support Vessels T-38, T-39 & T-40 ready for commissioning }} {{Infobox ship class overview |Builders=*SHM Shipcare *Abu Dhabi Ship Builders (ADSB) *Rodman 78 |Operators= [[Indian Navy]] |Class before= |Class after= |Subclasses= |Built range= |In commission range= 2014– |Total ships building= |Total ships planned= 23 |Total ships completed= 23 |Total ships cancelled= |Total ships active= 23<ref name=thin24m15/> |Total ships laid up= |Total ships lost= |Total ships retired= |Total ships scrapped= |Total ships preserved= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship type= [[Patrol boat]] |Ship displacement= |Ship length={{convert|25|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|6|m|abbr=on}}<ref name=shm>{{cite web|title=Products - Immediate Support Vessel|url=http://www.shmshipcare.com/craftway-isv.htm|publisher=SHM Shipcare|accessdate=5 June 2014}}</ref> |Ship draught={{convert|1.25|m|abbr=on}}<ref name=shm/> |Ship draft= |Ship power=2 × {{convert|1600|hp|abbr=on}} [[Caterpillar Inc.#Engines|Caterpillar engine]]s |Ship propulsion= [[Water jet (propulsion)|Water jet]] |Ship speed=*{{convert|40|kn}} max<ref name=toi30j14>{{cite news|title=81st Immediate Support Vessels squadron commissioned|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/81st-immediate-support-vessels-squadron-commissioned/articleshow/29610787.cms|accessdate=5 June 2014|publisher=The Times of India|date=30 January 2014}}</ref> *{{convert|35|kn}} at full load<ref name=shm/> *{{convert|15|kn|abbr=on}}-{{convert|20|kn|abbr=on}} cruising speed<ref name=shm/>
|Ship range={{convert|500|nmi|abbr=on}}<ref name=oki>{{cite news|title=Navy Commissions Three Immediate Support Vehicles|url=http://www.outlookindia.com/news/article/Navy-Commissions-Three-Immediate-Support-Vehicles/843247|accessdate=5 June 2014|publisher=Outlook|date=4 June 2014}}</ref> |Ship complement= 1 officer and six sailors |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament= Heavy and light machine guns |Ship armour= |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft= |Ship aircraft facilities= |Ship notes= }} |}
'''Immediate Support Vessel''' (ISV) is a type of light and armed [[patrol boat]] of the [[Indian Navy]].
==Design and description== The ISVs have been designed and built by SHM Shipcare, Abu Dhabi Ship Building (ADSB) and Rodman 78 of Spain, for the patrol boat requirement of India's [[Oil and Natural Gas Corporation]] (ONGC) and the Indian Navy.<ref name=toi30j14/><ref name=oki/><ref name=mbiz>{{cite web|title=DIAB core materials used to Build Immediate Support Vessels (ISVs) of ONGC by Indian Boat Builder|url=http://www.marinebiz360.com/knowledge_details.php?id=19|publisher=Marine Biz|accessdate=5 June 2014}}</ref> and were funded by ONGC.<ref>{{cite news|title=Three Immediate Support Vessels commissioned into Navy|url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/three-immediate-support-vessels-commissioned-into-navy/articleshow/45983774.cms|accessdate=23 January 2015|agency=The Economic Times|date=22 January 2015}}</ref>
The ISVs are made of [[fiberglass]] reinforced hulls, and are capable of operating in [[sea state]] 6 conditions. They are fitted with two Caterpillar engines, each of {{convert|1600|hp|abbr=on}}, which enables top speed of 40 knots using [[Water jet (propulsion)|water jet propulsion]], and a radius of operation of 500 nautical miles. The boats are armed with heavy and light machine guns, and also carry modern navigational and communication sensors and equipment for day and night surveillance. They also carry an inflatable Gemini boat to enable rapid insertion or extraction of the Indian Navy's [[MARCOS]] for search and rescue, law enforcement and maritime patrol. The patrol boats are commanded by an officer of the rank of [[Lieutenant]] and have a crew of six sailors, and can carry a total of 20 people on board.<ref name=shm/><ref name=toi30j14/><ref name=oki/><ref name=mbiz/><ref name=tniex5j/>
==Service history== One Immediate Support Vessel deployed at [[Bombay High]] fired at a fisherman in a boat. The incident occurred on Sunday, May 17, 2015, in the Arabian Sea, around 80 km off [[Mumbai]]. The boat had strayed into the high security and prohibited area of an offshore oil rig, and anchored close to it. anchored close to an oil platform. According to the navy's report, "despite repeated warnings, the boat refused to move out of the prohibited area, which is when the warning shots were fired into the water. One round deflected on hitting the water and hit a fisherman in a boat." He was evacuated in a helicopter and taken to a hospital, where is condition was reported to be stable.<ref>{{cite news|title=Indian Navy admits shooting at 'trespassing' fisherman|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/indian-navy-admits-shooting-trespassing-fisherman/article1-1348326.aspx|accessdate=22 May 2015|publisher=The Hindustan Times|date=May 18, 2015}}</ref>
===Vessels===
[[File:Hoisting of colours for the first time with Rashtriya Salute and singing of National Anthem to mark the commissioning ceremony of Immediate Support Vessels T-38, T-39 & T-40.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Commissioning ceremony of Immediate Support Vessels T-38, T-39 & T-40.jpg]] [[File:Vice Admiral Satish Soni signing the visitor's book the commissioning ceremony of Immediate Support Vessels T-38, T-39 & T-40.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Vice Admiral Satish Soni signing the visitor's book of T-39]] Seven boats were delivered to the [[Western Naval Command]] (WNC) on 30 January 2014,<ref name=toi30j14/><ref>{{cite news|title=Navy introduces Immediate Support Vessels|url=http://www.afternoondc.in/city-news/navy-introduces-immediate-support-vessels/article_102011|accessdate=5 June 2014|publisher=Afternoon DC|date=31 January 2014}}</ref> three boats were delivered to the [[Eastern Naval Command]] (ENC) on 5 June 2014,<ref name=thehin/> four boats T-26, T-27, T-28 and T-47 were commissioned into the WNC on 27 February 2015,<ref name=toi27f15>{{cite news|title=Fadnavis commissions 4 support vessels into Navy|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Fadnavis-commissions-4-support-vessels-into-Navy/articleshow/46397357.cms|accessdate=28 February 2015|publisher=Times of India|date=27 February 2015}}</ref> and three boats T-38, T-39 and T-40, were commissioned into ENC on 24 March 2015.<ref name=thin24m15/>
There are currently four operational squadrons of these boats in the Indian Navy. They are the ''81st ISV squadron'' composed of seven boats home-ported at [[Mumbai]] under the WNC,<ref name=toi30j14/> and six boats home-ported at [[Visakhapatnam]] under the ENC under the ''83rd ISV squadron'' composed of three boats T-35, T-36 and T-37,<ref name=tniex5j/> and the ''84th ISV squadron'' composed of three boats T-38, T-39 and T-40.<ref name=thin24m15>{{cite news|title=3 vessels join Navy to protect offshore assets|url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/andhra-pradesh/3-vessels-for-protecting-offshore-assets-commissioned-into-navy/article7027658.ece|accessdate=24 March 2015|publisher=The Hindu|date=24 March 2015}}</ref> Of the three initial boats of the 84th ISV squadron, two were constructed by Rodman Spain and the third one by Abu Dhabi Ship Builders (ADSB). The boats were delivered to the Navy Dockyard at Mumbai for Delivery Acceptance Trials, after which they sailed 1,200 nautical miles to Visakhapatnam in 12 days. The boats faced strong winds and high seas while crossing the [[Gulf of Mannar]], and satisfied the navy with their seaworthiness.<ref name=oi24m15>{{cite news|title=Navy commissions 3 more ISVs to augment coastal security|url=http://www.oneindia.com/india/navy-commissions-3-more-isvs-to-augment-coastal-security-1694124.html|accessdate=24 March 2015|date=24 March 2015}}</ref>
The navy plans to deploy a total of 23 boats, with ENC getting nine.<ref name=tniex5j>{{cite news|title=3 Immediate Support Vessels Inducted into ENC | url = http://www.newindianexpress.com/states/andhra_pradesh/3-Immediate-Support-Vessels-Inducted-into-ENC/2014/06/05/article2264258.ece|accessdate=5 June 2014|publisher=The New Indian Express|date=5 June 2014}}</ref><ref name=thehin>{{cite news|title=Navy gets 3 fast attack craft|url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/navy-gets-3-fast-attack-craft/article6083030.ece|accessdate=5 June 2014|publisher=The Hindu|date=5 June 2014}}</ref> All boats of this class are being commanded by officers of the rank of [[Lieutenant (navy)|Lieutenant]]. The boats T-26, T-27, T-28 and T-47 have been sponsored by the ONGC and are being manned by the navy, for the security of Mumbai and [[Bombay High]].<ref name=toi27f15/> The boats of the 84th ISV squadron will patrol off the coast of Visakhapatnam and [[Kakinada]].<ref name=thin24m15/>

Reference |- |T-11, T-12, T-13, T-14, T-15, T-16, T-17 |30 January 2014 |81st ISV squadron |[[Mumbai]] |Active |<ref name=toi30j14/> |- |T-35, T-36, T-37 |5 June 2014 |83rd ISV squadron |[[Visakhapatnam]] |Active |<ref name=tniex5j/><ref name=thehin/> |- |T-26, T-27, T-28 |27 February 2015 | rowspan="3" |82nd ISV squadron | rowspan="3" |[[Mumbai]] | rowspan="3" |Active | rowspan="3" |<ref name=toi27f15/><ref>{{Cite web|title = Indian Navy commissions 3 immediate support vessels - The Economic Times|url = http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/defence/indian-navy-commissions-3-immediate-support-vessels/articleshow/49155388.cms|website = The Economic Times|accessdate = 2015-12-26}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = Indian Navy inducts three Immediate Support Vessels into Eastern Naval Command {{!}} IHS Jane's 360|url = http://www.janes.com/article/50210/indian-navy-inducts-three-immediate-support-vessels-into-eastern-naval-command|website = www.janes.com|accessdate = 2015-12-26}}</ref> |- |T-44, T-45, T-46, T-47 |22 January 2015 |- |T-48, T-49, T-50 |29 September 2015 |- |T-38, T-39, T-40 |24 March 2015 |84th ISV squadron |[[Visakhapatnam]] |Active |<ref name="thin24m15" /> |}
